full_summary:
### Service Procurement ACAN
#### tender solicitation
-------------------------

* **Tender Reference Number**: #WS3831160496
* **Publication Date**: January 19, 2023
* **Tender Closing Date**: February 3, 2023 (14:00)
* **Expected Contract Start Date**: February 8, 2023
* **Expected Contract End Date**: February 17, 2026
* **Notice Type**: Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN)
* **Procurement Method**: Advance Contract Award Notice
* **Selection Criteria**: Not Applicable
* **Limited Tendering Reason**: Exclusive Rights
* **Trade Agreements**: World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
* **Region of Opportunity**: National Capital Region (NCR)
* **Region of Delivery**: National Capital Region (NCR)
* **Contracting Entity**: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* **End-User Entity**: Department of Health (HC)
* **Contact Information**:
	+ **Name**: Peter Gabriel (SPAC/PSPC)
	+ **Email**: peter.gabriel@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
	+ **Phone**: Not provided

#### Tender Description
The Government of Canada is issuing an Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN) tender solicitation under the Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) Contracting Authority. The procurement is for the Digital Inspector Support System (ACAN).

The scope of work includes software maintenance and support services to be delivered to the Department of Health (HC). The contract is expected to be in effect for a period of three years, with a possible extension for up to two additional years.

The ACAN notice was published on January 19, 2023, with a tender closing date of February 3, 2023. The contract award will be made to the supplier who has met all the requirements set out in the scope of work.

To access the full tender solicitation, please visit the following website: http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/15154083?extsite=MTUxNTQwODNfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==. Registered suppliers interested in this opportunity are required to login to the procurement platform and obtain a copy of the solicitation document.

Please note that this is a non-mandatory requirement and interested suppliers may still respond to the tender solicitation.

---

Note:
